ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Demonstrates how to simple multi-series financial charts, with a Candlestick chart rendering OHLC data and three line series rendering Moving Average indicators
ExampleDefinition.Description:
Demonstrates a multi-series chart using the [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#The%20Candlestick%20charts%20type.html']FastCandlestickRenderableSeries[/url] with three [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/The%20Line%20Series%20Type.html']FastLineRenderableSeries[/url] showing the moving average of the closing price.
The example uses the [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#Value%20Axis%20vs.%20Category%20Axis.html']CategoryDateTimeAxis[/url] which collapses overnight and weekend gaps in data, but, uses the Index to the data to calculate X-position. This means that [b]all DataSeries must have the same number of data-points[/b] [i](you can pad DataSeries using double.NaN for null or empty points)[/i].
[b]Example Usage[/b]
- ZoomPan, left-mouse drag to pan the chart - Mousewheel, roll the mousewheel to zoom - ZoomExtents, double click to zoom to extents
[b][i]Tip![/i][/b] To get the effect of hiding the line for the first N points of a moving average, you can [url='http://www.scichart.com/questions/question/hiding-data-when-using-a-line-series']insert double.NaN into the XyDataSeries[/url]. double.NaN can be used to render gaps or continuous lines.
